alert.note: Alert for Wexford (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 30 at 3:36PM EDT until April 04 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gaylord MI has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Michigan... Manistee River near Sherman in Wexford County. For the Manistee River...including Sherman...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Manistee River near Sherman. * WHEN...From early Saturday afternoon to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding begins around the Wilderness Canoe livery along left bank of river just downstream of M-37 bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 12.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Manistee River Sherman 15.0 12.7 Thu 3 pm EDT 13.3 15.1 15.2 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels starting Friday afternoon, and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued when new river forecast information becomes available.
